comments.author: MIner1448
comments.body: Indeed, Bitcoin mining on PC is currently not an efficient way to make money. However, there are many altcoins that can be mined on a PC using the CPU or GPU. The choice of cryptocurrency depends on many factors, such as your PC hashrate, mining difficulty, coin value, transaction fees, etc.Some of the more popular altcoins for PC mining currently include:1.Monero (XMR) is a cryptocurrency that uses a mining algorithm that allows it to be mined on the CPU. It is one of the most popular altcoins for PC mining due to its high privacy and anonymity.2.Ethereum (ETH) is the second largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization after bitcoin. Ethereum mining requires a GPU and its mining algorithm is called Ethash. However, the difficulty of mining Ethereum is high and it is necessary to have a powerful computer to mine profitably.3.Ravencoin (RVN) is a cryptocurrency that uses the X16Rv2 mining algorithm, which allows it to be mined on the GPU. Ravencoin has a low mining difficulty which makes it attractive to miners.4.Grin (GRIN) is a cryptocurrency that uses a mining algorithm known as Cuckoo Cycle that can be mined on the GPU. Grin was created with the goal of providing maximum privacy and anonymity.5.Zcash (ZEC) is a cryptocurrency that uses the Equihash mining algorithm, which can be mined on the GPU. Zcash was created with the goal of keeping transactions private, and this makes it attractive to miners.
